description: Citing cascading unrest and exposed system weaknesses, Sven Halek advises the Council to impose an immediate civilian communications shutdown, framing it as a necessary act of security and control.

The Council holds an emergency meeting. Guided by Sven Halek’s strategic recommendations, the Directorate authorizes a total shutdown of non-official digital communication across Stenograd, limiting civilian access to information.
With no warning, all civilian digital networks are suspended. Only official statements and emergency alerts are permitted. Daily routines are disrupted as people are cut off from news and each other.

In response to the silence, citizens begin using handwritten notes, coded signs, and word-of-mouth networks to communicate beyond BCI surveillance. Fragments of old Halden-Council debates leak into these analog channels.

A coordinated silent protest erupts across major boulevards. Citizens line the streets in complete silence, signaling mass defiance. Public trust in Council authority and official messaging collapses.
